By: Rand Fishkin February 23, 2006 Beauty in URLs Keyword Research The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. Mike Schinkel has an older, but golden post on the beauty of URLs. There's nothing revolutionary here, but since I've been seeing so many ugly URLs in the SERPs lately (have hyphens and subdomains made a comeback with BigDaddy or is it just me?), I have to step in. A few of his rules include: Well Designed URLs Point to Content that Does Not Change Well Designed URLs Don't Change Well Designed URLs Can Be Stored Well Designed URLs Only Use Parameters with Forms-Driven Queries Well Designed URLs are Readable and Heirarchical Well Designed URLs Mean Something He's got more and they're all good. Stick to these and you'll be in the land of happy browsers and searchers. Copied! Back to Top
